newsitem.title: MALTA: Maltese ecologists strike against Hilton. [corrected 01:00 gmt 7/1]
newsitem.headline: Maltese ecologists strike against Hilton. [corrected 01:00 gmt 7/1]

text.p: Three Maltese environmentalists on Monday started a hunger strike to protest the building of a new Hilton hotel near Valletta.
The protesters, camping outside the prime minister's office in Valletta, say the new site will spoil the marina.
Hilton has demolished its existing 30 year-old hotel to replace it by a $100 million complex in Saint Julians, four miles north of Valletta.

The hunger strike was the latest in a series of protests by the environmentalists against the planned hotel, which is owned by a group of Maltese businessmen. (Corrects to show hotel is not owned by Hilton Hotels Corp.)
Some ecologists nearly drowned during the summer after they chained themselves in the sea to a barge being used to transport rubble from the development site.
